subject: Education
title: Reliability: Consistency Across Time and Raters
description: A micro-lesson that makes Reliability: Consistency Across Time and Raters usable.

hook.text: Two teachers grade the same essay. One gives it an A, the other a C. Which one is right?

buildup.text: Reliability means an assessment produces consistent results regardless of who grades it or when.

discovery.text: Inter-rater reliability measures whether different graders assign similar scores to the same work.

twist.text: Essay grading can be so unreliable that random assignment of graders changes grades by a full letter.

climax.text: Structured rubrics and calibration training improve reliabilityâ€”but never make it perfect.

punchline.text: If two graders can't agree, the grade is a coin toss.

quiz.question: What does inter-rater reliability measure?
options: Whether different graders assign similar scores to the same work
Whether a test is timed correctly
Whether students study enough before a test
